page.title: 12SISTER MARY'S ASSEMBLY.
page.content: IN SCHOOL ASSEMBLY, SISTER MARY, A {MISSIONARY} FROM SIERRA LEONE, TOLD OF HER HOUSE OF MUD AND MEALS OF RICE AND FRUIT. SHE TAUGHT THE AFRICAN CHILDREN AS THEY BROUGHT STONE AND SAND TO BUILD THEIR SCHOOL. BEGINNING AT EIGHT A.M. THEY HAD MANY LESSONS {OUTSIDE}, WRITING IN THE SAND.{NO COMPUTERS {THERE!} ONE INTERESTING CUSTOM WAS TO GREET PEOPLE BY ASKING, "{HOW IS THE {INSIDE OF YOUR BONES?"}SISTER MARY, ONE NIGHT, FOUND A SNAKE UNDER HER WARDROBE, AND, FEELING TERRIFIED, KILLED IT WITH A BRUSH - {BRAVE LADY! RETURNING TO ENGLAND, SHE BROUGHT WITH HER BETTY, A{HANDICAPPED CHILD},WITH NO {ARMS.} MARY HELPED TO TRAIN BETTY TO BECOME A CIVIL SERVANT. AFTER THIS DELIGHTFUL VISIT BY SISTER MARY, WE SAID, "{BISIE}", WHICH, IN THE MENDE LANGUAGE, MEANS {THANKYOU!}
